The hierarchy of health organizations differs from one
country to another.  The titles,  levels, and scope ofresponsibility may vary, but the roles and goals of peoplein key positions are the same.  Persons assigned to thesepositions have a larger scope of work than regular staffand have to deal with a number of people in the health unitwhere they work.
Introduction9
In a provincial health office, the managers include the
